title: How to Create Subscript in Microsoft Office, Google Docs, & TextEdit

steps.title: Open a document in Microsoft Office.
steps.content: Open a document in Microsoft Office. You can either open an existing document or create a new Word , PowerPoint or Excel document. You need to purchase a subscription to Office365 to use Microsoft Office applications on your desktop computer. A free 30-day trial is available.

steps.title: Highlight the text you want to format.
steps.content: Highlight the text you want to format. Click and drag over the text you want to convert to subscript.

steps.title: Press Ctrl on PC or ⇧ Shift+- on Mac (Word and PowerPoint Only).
steps.content: Press Ctrl on PC or ⇧ Shift + - on Mac (Word and PowerPoint Only). If you are using Word or PowerPoint, the easiest way to convert highlighted text to subscript is to use the keyboard shortcut.

steps.title: Click the Home tab.
steps.content: Click the Home tab. It's in the menu bar at the top of the page.

steps.title: Click X2 (Word Only).
steps.content: Click X 2 (Word Only). If you are using Microsoft Word, you can click the icon that resembles a large "X" with a subscript "2" next to it. It's in the "Font" box under the "Home" tab at the top of the page. This will convert the highlighted text to a subscript format. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the Font Settings icon (PowerPoint & Excel only).
steps.content: Click the Font Settings icon (PowerPoint & Excel only). If you are using PowerPoint or Excel, click the icon that resembles a folded page corner with a diagonal arrow in the lower-right corner of the "Font" box in the menu bar at the top of the page. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Check "Subscript."
steps.content: Check "Subscript." It's in the box labeled "Effects" in the Font Settings menu. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Ok.
steps.content: Click Ok . It's in the lower-right corner. This will convert the highlighted text into subscript format.

steps.title: Go to https://outlook.live.com/ and log in.
steps.content: Go to https://outlook.live.com/ and log in. Log in with your Microsoft/Office365 account. This will open your Outlook mailbox.

steps.title: Click one of the Office programs.
steps.content: Click one of the Office programs. You can see the Office programs listed in the menu bar to the left. Click the blue icon for Word, the green icon for Excel, or the red icon for PowerPoint.

steps.title: Open or create a new document.
steps.content: Open or create a new document. You can click a document in the list of recent documents on the main page, or click Blank document at the top of the page to create a new document.

steps.title: Highlight the text you want to format.
steps.content: Highlight the text you want to format. Click and drag over the text you want to convert to subscript.

steps.title: Click the Home tab.
steps.content: Click the Home tab. It's in the menu bar at the top.

steps.title: Click ⋯.
steps.content: Click ⋯ . It's the icon with three dots in the Font menu at the top of the page. This displays the More Font Options menu.

steps.title: Click Subscript.
steps.content: Click Subscript . It's next to an icon that says "X 2 ". This converts the highlighted text to a subscript format.

steps.title: Open a Microsoft Office app.
steps.content: Open a Microsoft Office app. Tap the Word, PowerPoint, or Excel icon on your Home screen or Apps menu to open a Microsoft Office app on your smartphone. The Word app has a blue icon. Excel has a green icon, and PowerPoint has a red icon. You can download Microsoft Office apps from the Google Play Store on Android phones and tablets , or from the App Store on iPhone and iPad . You need to purchase a subscription to Office365 to use Microsoft Office applications on your desktop computer. Though a free 30-day trial is available.

steps.title: Open or create a new document.
steps.content: Open or create a new document. You can tap a saved document in the list of recent documents on the main page. Or you can tap the plus (+) icon in the upper-right corner to create a new document.

steps.title: Highlight the text you want to format.
steps.content: Highlight the text you want to format. To do so, tap and hold a word or characters you want to highlight. Then tap and drag the character markers on both sides of the highlighted text to adjust the highlighted portion of the text.

steps.title: Tap the Font icon.
steps.content: Tap the Font icon. It's the icon that resembles a capital "A" with a pencil in front of it. It's at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Select the Home menu.
steps.content: Select the Home menu. Use the drop-down menu in the lower-left corner to select the "Home" menu. This displays the home menu at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap More Formatting.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap More Formatting . This displays options for formatting text.

steps.title: Tap Subscript.
steps.content: Tap Subscript . It's the first option at the top of the menu. This converts the highlighted text to a subscript format.

steps.title: Go to https://docs.google.com/ and log in.
steps.content: Go to https://docs.google.com/ and log in. Log in with your Google account if you haven't already done so. This will open your Google Docs page.

steps.title: Open the Google Doc you want to edit.
steps.content: Open the Google Doc you want to edit. You can click a saved document under "Recent," or click Blank at the top of the page to open a new blank document.

steps.title: Highlight the text you want to convert into subscript.
steps.content: Highlight the text you want to convert into subscript. You can use your mouse to highlight any part of text in the document.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+, on PC or ⌘ Command+, on Mac.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + , on PC or ⌘ Command + , on Mac. The easiest way to convert text to subscript is to use the keyboard shortcut. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Format tab on the top-left.
steps.content: Click the Format tab on the top-left. This button is located on a tab bar below the document name near the upper-left corner of the page. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Hover over Text on the Format menu.
steps.content: Hover over Text on the Format menu. This will open your text options on a sub-menu. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click Subscript on the Text menu.
steps.content: Click Subscript on the Text menu. This will convert the highlighted text into a subscript format. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Google Docs app.
steps.content: Open the Google Docs app. It has an icon that resembles a blue page. Tap the Google Docs icon on your Home screen or apps menu. [8] X Research source You can download the Google Docs app from the Google Play Store on Android phones and tablets , or from the App Store on iPhone and iPad . If you are not logged in, go ahead and Log in with your Google account .

steps.title: Open or create a new document.
steps.content: Open or create a new document. You can tap a saved document below "Last opened by me," or tap the plus (+) icon in the lower-right corner to create a new document.

steps.title: Highlight the text you want to format.
steps.content: Highlight the text you want to format. To do so, tap and hold a word or characters you want to highlight. Then tap and drag the character markers on both sides of the highlighted text to adjust the highlighted portion of the text.

steps.title: Tap the font icon.
steps.content: Tap the font icon. It's the icon that resembles a capital "A" with lines next to it. It's at the top of the page. This displays the Font menu at the bottom of the screen. You may need to tap the center of the screen to display the options at the top of the page.

steps.title: Tap the Text tab.
steps.content: Tap the Text tab. It's the first tab at the top of the menu at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap X2.
steps.content: Tap X 2 . It's the last button at the top of the menu at the bottom of the screen. It's below the "Text" and "Paragraph" tabs. This converts the highlighted text to a subscript format. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Open the text document you want to edit in TextEdit.
steps.content: Open the text document you want to edit in TextEdit. You can open a saved document in TextEdit or open a new, blank page, start writing from scratch.

steps.title: Highlight the text you want to convert into subscript.
steps.content: Highlight the text you want to convert into subscript. You can use your mouse or your keyboard to select the part of text you want to convert into subscript. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Format button on the menu bar.
steps.content: Click the Format button on the menu bar. You can find this button on your Mac's menu bar at the top of your screen. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Hover over Font on the Format menu.
steps.content: Hover over Font on the Format menu. This will show your font tools on a sub-menu. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Hover over Baseline on the Font menu.
steps.content: Hover over Baseline on the Font menu. This will show your baseline options on a sub-menu. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Select Subscript on the Baseline menu.
steps.content: Select Subscript on the Baseline menu. This will instantly convert the selected text into subscript. [14] X Research source
